title: Drawing, "Sketches of Ornamental Motifs and Running Figures", October 20, 1886
medium: Charcoal, red chalk, pen and black ink on off-white wove paper
markings:
Watermark, vertically in upper right corner : Lalanne.
Stamped twice in ink, at lower left: "Museum for the Arts of Decoration, Cooper Union."
inscribed: Inscribed in ?, at center across lower half:  A Call for Volunteers, Oct. 20th 1886; and again upside down in graphite, in lower right corner:  Monday 1.50, Tuesday .75, Wed., Thursday .75" [with large X crossing words out].
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description: Thick charcoal line divides sheet horizontally into two sections. Upper section contains three groups of figures: large, indistinct one at right; woman with two children, center, moving left; and the third group is in chaotic motion, at left; verso: at bottom right are ornamental motifs; at center is a blotter of two very rough sketches of people running, beside a vertical line.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketches of Ornamental Motifs and Running Figures", October 20, 1886.
October 20, 1886. Charcoal, red chalk, pen and black ink on off-white wove paper. Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-210.
